edu.rit.p3.data

Class BeerJdbcManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.jdbc.support.JdbcAccessor
      • org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate
        • edu.rit.p3.data.BeerJdbcManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcOperations

    public class BeerJdbcManager
extends org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate

    The instance of BeerJdbcManager serves as the DATA LAYER. This instance is intended to be used by the instance of BeerController (Business Layer) as a way of efficiently and securely interacting with the Beer Database.

    Author:
    Alex Aiezza

        Uses a given token hash to query for a user's authentication token

      • INSERT_TOKEN_FOR_USER

        private static final String INSERT_TOKEN_FOR_USER

        SQL: "INSERT INTO Token ( TokenHash, Username, Expiration ) VALUES ( ?, ?, (DATETIME(\'now\', ?)) );"

        With a given Username, this query inserts the authorization token
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UPDATE_TOKEN_FOR_EXPIRATION

        private static final String UPDATE_TOKEN_FOR_EXPIRATION

        SQL: "UPDATE Token SET Expiration = (DATETIME(\'now\', ?)) WHERE Username = ?;"

        With a given TokenHash, this query updates the authorization token's expiration time
        See Also:

      • TOKEN_EXPIRATION_MINUTES

        private final String TOKEN_EXPIRATION_MINUTES
        This is retrieved from a project3.properties.
        This is the SQLite varchar that will offset how long the token will expire from NOW. For more detail, visit the SQLite Reference and look in the Modifiers section.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteTokenByHash

        public void deleteTokenByHash(String hash)
        Deletes an entry in the Token table
        Parameters:
        hash - the tokenHash of the row in the Token table to delete

      • getBeerByName

        public Beer getBeerByName(String beerName)
                   throws BeerNotFoundException
        Retrieve a beer by its name from the database
        Parameters:
        beerName - the name of the beer to retrieve
        Returns:
        the beer object with the given name
        Throws:
        BeerNotFoundException - Thrown when a beer name cannot be found in the database

      • getBeers

        public List<Beer> getBeers()
        Get all beers in the database
        Returns:
        A List of all the beers in the database

      • getTokenByHash

        public Token getTokenByHash(String hash)
                     throws AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException
        Retrieve the authorization token for a given hash
        Parameters:
        hash - hashcode of the token to look for
        Returns:
        the token with the given hashcode
        Throws:
        AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException - Thrown when an given hashcode does not have a token

      • getTokenByUsername

        public Token getTokenByUsername(String username)
                         throws AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException
        Retrieve the authorization token for a given username
        Parameters:
        username - username to get the token for
        Returns:
        the token of the given username
        Throws:
        AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException - Thrown when an given username does not have a token

      • getUserByUsername

        public User getUserByUsername(String username)
                       throws UserNotFoundException
        Retrieve a user by its username from the database
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to retrieve
        Returns:
        the user object with the given username
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - Thrown when a username cannot be found in the database

      • getUsers

        public List<User> getUsers()
        Get all user in the database
        Returns:
        A List of all the users in the database

      • prepare

        private PreparedStatement prepare(String sqlStatement)
                           throws SQLException
        Just a quick little method for preparing SQL statements. This is done in an effort to reduce code duplication.
        Parameters:
        sqlStatement - the statement to prepare on the connection given to this manager.
        Returns:
        The prepared statement. The returned statement must still be processed by setting any ? characters in it. Then it may be executed.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown when an issue preparing the SQL statement occurs

      • updatePriceOfBeer

        public boolean updatePriceOfBeer(String beerName,
                                 double price)
                          throws BeerNotFoundException
        Update the price of a beer
        Parameters:
        beerName - the name of the beer to change the price of
        price - the new price of the beer
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful. This method will return false if the database does not accept the SQL.
        Throws:
        BeerNotFoundException - Thrown if the given beer name is not found

      • updateUserToken

        public boolean updateUserToken(User user)
        Update the authorization token of a user
        Parameters:
        user - The user to update the token for, or to create a token for if it does not exist.
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful. false if the user's password is incorrect.
